comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The SS Patris was a Greek ocean liner that unsuccessfully attempted to tow the damaged liner SS Thessaloniki in December, 1915. The Patris then took Thessaloniki's passengers to New York and Thessaloniki was scuttled. fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%2014/New%20York%20NY%20Herald... See also:

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.wrecksite.eu/wreck.aspx?172100 "On January 5th, 1916, SS Thessaloniki was on a voyage from Piraeus to New York, when she was scuttled 350 miles East from Sandy Hook. Her engines were disabled since December 22nd and a tow effort to port was unsuccessful." See The Ogden standard., January 07, 1916, 4 P.M. CITY EDITION, page 1, right-hand column chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058396/1916-01-07/ed-... for more on the Thessaloniki sinking.
